009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015
016import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.subtract;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Vector version (simplified ) with greatly reduced memory requirements. This code is based on the Anisotropic
021 * Diffusion filter proposed by Perona and Malik, as proposed in [1]. See Sec. 17.3.2 of [2] for additional details. The
022 * filter operates on all types of grayscale (scalar) and RGB color images. Consult the source code of the related
023 * ImageJ plugins for examples.
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * [1] Pietro Perona and Jitendra Malik, "Scale-space and edge detection using anisotropic diffusion", IEEE Transactions
027 * on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, vol. 12, no. 4, pp. 629-639 (July 1990).
028 * <br>
029 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
030 * (2022).
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2021/01/04
035 */     
036public class PeronaMalikFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector implements PeronaMalikF {
037        
038        private final float alpha;
039        private final int iterations;           // number of iterations
040        private final ConductanceFunction g;
041        private ColorMode colorMode;
042        
043        // constructor - using default parameters
044        public PeronaMalikFilterVector () {
045                this(new Parameters());
046        }
047        
048        // constructor - use this version to set all parameters
049        public PeronaMalikFilterVector (Parameters params) {
050                this.iterations = params.iterations;
051                this.alpha = (float) params.alpha;
052                this.g = ConductanceFunction.get(params.conductanceFunType, (float)params.kappa);
053                this.colorMode = params.colorMode;
054        }
055        
056        // ------------------------------------------------------
057        
058        @Override
059        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
060                /*   
061                 *  NH pixels:      directions:
062                 *      p4              3
063                 *   p3 p0 p1         2 x 0
064                 *      p2              1
065                 */
066                float[][] A = new float[4][];   // p[i][k]: 4 pixel colors from the 3x3 neigborhood
067                float[] Ac =  pack.getPix(u, v);
068//              A[0] = pack.getVec(u, v);
069                A[0] = pack.getPix(u + 1, v);
070                A[1] = pack.getPix(u, v - 1);
071                A[2] = pack.getPix(u - 1, v);
072                A[3] = pack.getPix(u, v + 1);
073                
074                float[] result = Ac.clone(); //A[0].clone();
075                
076                switch (colorMode) {
077                case BrightnessGradient:
078                        float bc = getBrightness(Ac);
079                        for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
080                                float bi = getBrightness(A[i]);
081                                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
082                                        float gi = g.eval(Math.abs(bi - bc));
083                                        result[k] = result[k] + alpha * gi * (A[i][k] - Ac[k]);
084                                }
085                        }
086                        break;
087                case ColorGradient:
088                        for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
089                                float[] D = subtract(A[i], Ac);
090                                float gi = g.eval(Matrix.normL2(D));    // g applied to color gradient magnitude
091                                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
092                                        result[k] = result[k] + alpha * gi * D[k];
093                                }
094                        }
095                        break;
096                default:
097                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("color mode option " + colorMode.name() +
098                                        " not implemented in class " + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
099                }
100                
101                return result;
102        }
103
104        @Override
105        protected final int passesRequired() {
106                return iterations;      // this filter needs T passes
107        }
108        
109        private final float getBrightness(float[] p) {
110                return 0.299f * p[0] + 0.587f * p[1] + 0.114f * p[2];
111        }
112        
113}
